contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox State Representative | name= Jeffrey L. Barnhart | image name= | state_house=North Carolina | state=North Carolina | district= 82nd | term= 2001-2011 | preceded= Tim Tallent | succeeded= Larry Pittman | party=[[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] | birth_date={{birth date and age|1956|03|05}} | birth_place=[[Waverly, Tioga County, New York|Waverly, New York]] | death_date= | death_place= | alma_mater=[[Southern Illinois University]] | profession= | spouse= | residence=[[Concord, North Carolina]] | religion= |}} '''Jeffrey L. Barnhart''' (born March 5, 1956) is a [[United States Republican Party|Republican]] member of the [[North Carolina General Assembly]] representing the state's Eighty-second House District, including constituents in [[Cabarrus County, North Carolina|Cabarrus]] County. A businessman, Barnhart served in the state's [[North Carolina House of Representatives|House of Representatives]] from 2001-2011.<ref>http://www.ncga.state.nc.us/gascripts/members/viewMember.pl?nUserID=285&sChamber=H</ref> He resigned September 30, 2011, to join the consulting firm [[McGuireWoods]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Leslie|first=Laura|title=Barnhart steps down to join consulting firm|url=http://www.wral.com/news/state/nccapitol/blogpost/9973872/|work=WRAL website|publisher=WRAL TV|accessdate=27 October 2011}}</ref> ==Personal life== Barnhart was born in [[Waverly, Tioga County, New York|Waverly, New York]] to Fred Harrison and Mildred Lorraine Sjostrom Barnhart. He and his wife Jody (Springston) have four children and one other child with another.<ref>http://www.ciclt.net/sn/pol/po_detail.aspx?ClientCode=nclm&P_ID=ncsh082</ref> ==Education== Graduated from Waverly High School in 1974. He then attended [[Southern Illinois University]] and earned a Bachelors of Science degree in Industrial Technology in 1981. ==Military service== Served in the [[United States Air Force]] from 1978-82. ==Early Political career== * Cabarrus County Commissioner – 10 years * Acting County Manager – Cabarrus County – 8 months * Cabarrus Economic Development Board of Directors – 9 years * Water & Sewer Authority of Cabarrus County – 6 years ==Conservatism== Barnhart serves on the board of directors for the conservative nonprofit website, [[Rightchange.com]].<ref>http://www.rightchange.com/contact</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{North Carolina House of Representatives}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Barnhart, Jeffrey | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH =1956-03-05 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Waverly, Tioga County, New York|Waverly, New York]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Barnhart, Jeffrey}} [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:North Carolina Republicans]]
